Suite.Title: Bing Ads

XPath.Fail.Message: No data found with current filters

RestConnector.Title: Account Performance
RestConnector.HelpText: Use this report to observe long-term account performance and trends.

Field.Title: AccountName [D]
Field.HelpText: The account name.

Field.Title: TimePeriod [D]
Field.HelpText: The time period of each report row.

Field.Title: DeviceType [D]
Field.HelpText: The device name attribute of a device OS target bid. The type of device which showed ads.

Field.Title: Network [D]
Field.HelpText: The combined search advertising marketplace made up of Bing, AOL, Yahoo, and partner sites.

Field.Title: DeliveredMatchType [D]
Field.HelpText: The match type used to deliver an ad.

Field.Title: AccountStatus [D]
Field.HelpText: The account status.

Field.Title: AdDistribution [D]
Field.HelpText: The network where you want your ads to show.
The number of times an ad has been displayed on search results pages.
Clicks are what you pay for. Clicks typically include a customer clicking an ad on a search results page or on a website on the search network.
The click-through rate (CTR) is the number of times an ad was clicked, divided by the number of times the ad was shown (impressions).
The average cost per click (CPC). The total cost of all clicks on an ad divided by the number of clicks.
The cost per click (CPC) summed for each click.
The average position of the ad on a webpage.
The number of conversions. A conversion is the completion of an action by a customer after viewing your ad.
The number of conversions, divided by the total number of clicks.
The formula for calculating the cost per conversion is (Spend / Conversions).
Clicks that exhibit a low likelihood of commercial intent.
The low-quality clicks as a percentage.
The number of impressions that result from low-quality keyword searches.
The low-quality impressions as a percentage.
The number of conversions that originate from low-quality clicks.
The low-quality conversion rate as a percentage.
The estimated percentage of impressions, out of the total available impressions in the market you were targeting.
The number of times your tracked number was shown on all devices.
The number of total calls to the tracked phone number that showed with your ad.
The phone-through rate (Ptr).
The number of conversions from other ads within the same account that were preceded by one or more clicks from this ad.
The revenue optionally reported by the advertiser as a result of conversions.
The return on ad spend (ROAS). The formula for calculating the ROAS is (Revenue / Spend).
The cost per assist. The formula for calculating the cost per assist is (Spend / Assists).
The revenue per conversion. The formula for calculating the revenue per conversion is (Revenue / Conversions).
The revenue per assist. The formula for calculating the revenue per assist is (Revenue / Assists).
Clicks that are filtered by general methods, such as blacklists and activity-based detection, and that exhibit a low likelihood of commercial intent.
Invalid clicks that use sophisticated means to appear valid.
The Bing Ads assigned identifier of an account.
The Bing Ads assigned number of an account.
The Bing Ads assigned identifier of a customer.

Field.Title: CustomerName [D]
Field.HelpText: The customer name.

RestConnector.Title: Ad Group Performance
RestConnector.HelpText: Compare how well different versions of your ad extensions are performing with each ad.

Text.Title: Filter by Ad Group Id (Optional)
Text.HelpText: Requires AccountId and CampaignId Filters if used

Field.Title: AccountName [D]
Field.HelpText: The account name.

Field.Title: CampaignName [D]
Field.HelpText: The campaign name.

Field.Title: AdGroupName [D]
Field.HelpText: The ad group name.

Field.Title: TimePeriod [D]
Field.HelpText: The time period of each report row.

Field.Title: DeviceType [D]
Field.HelpText: The device name attribute of a device OS target bid. The type of device which showed ads.

Field.Title: Network [D]
Field.HelpText: The combined search advertising marketplace made up of Bing, AOL, Yahoo, and partner sites.

Field.Title: DeliveredMatchType [D]
Field.HelpText: The match type used to deliver an ad.

Field.Title: AdDistribution [D]
Field.HelpText: The network where you want your ads to show.

Field.Title: Status [D]
Field.HelpText: The current entity status.
The number of times an ad has been displayed on search results pages.
Clicks are what you pay for. Clicks typically include a customer clicking an ad on a search results page or on a website on the search network.
The click-through rate (CTR) is the number of times an ad was clicked, divided by the number of times the ad was shown (impressions).
The average cost per click (CPC). The total cost of all clicks on an ad divided by the number of clicks.
How closely related your ads is to the customer's search query or other input.
The cost per click (CPC) summed for each click.
The average position of the ad on a webpage.
The number of conversions. A conversion is the completion of an action by a customer after viewing your ad.
The number of conversions, divided by the total number of clicks.
The formula for calculating the cost per conversion is (Spend / Conversions).
The estimated percentage of impressions, out of the total available impressions in the market you were targeting.
The number of times your tracked number was shown on all devices.
The number of total calls to the tracked phone number that showed with your ad.
An aggregate quality assessment of all landing pages on your site.
How well your keyword competes against other keywords targeting the same traffic.
Historical average of ad relevance scores back as far as 18 months from the current date.
Historical average of landing page experience scores back as far as 18 months from the current date.
The phone-through rate (Ptr).
The number of conversions from other ads within the same account that were preceded by one or more clicks from this ad.
The revenue optionally reported by the advertiser as a result of conversions.
The numeric score shows you how competitive your ads are in the marketplace by measuring how relevant your keywords and landing pages are to customers' search terms.
The return on ad spend (ROAS). The formula for calculating the ROAS is (Revenue / Spend).
The cost per assist. The formula for calculating the cost per assist is (Spend / Assists).
The revenue per conversion. The formula for calculating the revenue per conversion is (Revenue / Conversions).
The revenue per assist. The formula for calculating the revenue per assist is (Revenue / Assists).
The Bing Ads assigned identifier of an account.
The Bing Ads assigned identifier of a campaign.
The Bing Ads assigned identifier of an ad group.
The Bing Ads assigned number of an account.

HttpSettings.RequestBody: @{ string RequiredFields = "TimePeriod"; } <s:Envelope xmlns:s="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/"> @GenerateDefaultSubmitHeader() <s:Body> <SubmitGenerateReportRequest xmlns="https://bingads.microsoft.com/Reporting/v13"> <ReportRequest i:type="AdGroupPerformanceReportRequest" xmlns:i="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"> @GenerateDefaultSubmitOptions() <Aggregation>@(Model.Aggregation)</Aggregation> <Columns> @GenerateReportColumns(Model.SelectedFields, RequiredFields, "AdGroupPerformance") </Columns> <Filter/> <Scope> <AccountIds xmlns:a1="http://schemas.microsoft.com/2003/10/Serialization/Arrays"> <a1:long>@(Model.AccountId)</a1:long> </AccountIds> @(!string.IsNullOrEmpty(Model.CampaignId) ? GenerateCampaignsScope() : string.Empty) @(!string.IsNullOrEmpty(Model.CampaignId) && !string.IsNullOrEmpty(Model.AdGroupId) ? GenerateAdGroupsScope() : string.Empty) </Scope> @GenerateTimeScope() </ReportRequest> </SubmitGenerateReportRequest> </s:Body> </s:Envelope>

RestConnector.Title: Ad Performance
RestConnector.HelpText: Use this report to help you determine which ads lead to clicks and conversions, and which are not performing.

Text.Title: Filter by Ad Group Id (Optional)
Text.HelpText: Requires AccountId and CampaignId Filters if used

Field.Title: AccountName [D]
Field.HelpText: The account name.

Field.Title: CampaignName [D]
Field.HelpText: The campaign name.

Field.Title: AdGroupName [D]
Field.HelpText: The ad group name.

Field.Title: AdTitle [D]
Field.HelpText: The ad title.

Field.Title: TimePeriod [D]
Field.HelpText: The time period of each report row.

Field.Title: DeviceType [D]
Field.HelpText: The device name attribute of a device OS target bid. The type of device which showed ads.

Field.Title: Network [D]
Field.HelpText: The combined search advertising marketplace made up of Bing, AOL, Yahoo, and partner sites.

Field.Title: DeliveredMatchType [D]
Field.HelpText: The match type used to deliver an ad.

Field.Title: AdType [D]
Field.HelpText: The ad type.

Field.Title: AdStatus [D]
Field.HelpText: The ad status.

Field.Title: AdDistribution [D]
Field.HelpText: The network where you want your ads to show.
The number of times an ad has been displayed on search results pages.
Clicks are what you pay for. Clicks typically include a customer clicking an ad on a search results page or on a website on the search network.
The click-through rate (CTR) is the number of times an ad was clicked, divided by the number of times the ad was shown (impressions).
The cost per click (CPC) summed for each click.
The average position of the ad on a webpage.
The number of conversions. A conversion is the completion of an action by a customer after viewing your ad.
The number of conversions, divided by the total number of clicks.
The formula for calculating the cost per conversion is (Spend / Conversions).
The number of conversions from other ads within the same account that were preceded by one or more clicks from this ad.
The revenue optionally reported by the advertiser as a result of conversions.
The return on ad spend (ROAS). The formula for calculating the ROAS is (Revenue / Spend).
The cost per assist. The formula for calculating the cost per assist is (Spend / Assists).
The revenue per conversion. The formula for calculating the revenue per conversion is (Revenue / Conversions).
The revenue per assist. The formula for calculating the revenue per assist is (Revenue / Assists).

Field.Title: AdDescription [D]
Field.HelpText: The first ad description that appears below the path in your ad.

Field.Title: DestinationUrl [D]
Field.HelpText: he destination URL attribute of the ad, keyword, or ad group criterion.

Field.Title: DisplayUrl [D]
Field.HelpText: The ad display URL.

Field.Title: Headline [D]
Field.HelpText: The shorter of two possible responsive ad headlines for Audience campaigns.

Field.Title: Path1 [D]
Field.HelpText: The path 1 attribute of an ad.
The Bing Ads assigned identifier of an account.
The Bing Ads assigned identifier of a campaign.
The Bing Ads assigned identifier of an ad group.
The Bing Ads assigned identifier of an ad.
The Bing Ads assigned number of an account.

HttpSettings.RequestBody: @{ string RequiredFields = "TimePeriod"; } <s:Envelope xmlns:s="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/"> @GenerateDefaultSubmitHeader() <s:Body> <SubmitGenerateReportRequest xmlns="https://bingads.microsoft.com/Reporting/v13"> <ReportRequest i:type="AdPerformanceReportRequest" xmlns:i="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"> @GenerateDefaultSubmitOptions() <Aggregation>@(Model.Aggregation)</Aggregation> <Columns> @GenerateReportColumns(Model.SelectedFields, RequiredFields, "AdPerformance") </Columns> <Filter/> <Scope> <AccountIds xmlns:a1="http://schemas.microsoft.com/2003/10/Serialization/Arrays"> <a1:long>@(Model.AccountId)</a1:long> </AccountIds> @(!string.IsNullOrEmpty(Model.CampaignId) ? GenerateCampaignsScope() : string.Empty) @(!string.IsNullOrEmpty(Model.CampaignId) && !string.IsNullOrEmpty(Model.AdGroupId) ? GenerateAdGroupsScope() : string.Empty) </Scope> @GenerateTimeScope() </ReportRequest> </SubmitGenerateReportRequest> </s:Body> </s:Envelope>

RestConnector.Title: Budget Summary
RestConnector.HelpText: Use this report to discover how your campaign's budget is performing day by day.

Field.Title: Account Name
Field.HelpText: The account name.

Field.Title: Campaign Name
Field.HelpText: The campaign name.

Field.Title: Daily Spend
Field.HelpText: The average amount of campaign budget spent per day.

Field.Title: Date
Field.HelpText: The date for the downloaded report records. The date will be in the time zone of the campaign

Field.Title: Monthly Budget
Field.HelpText: The average amount of campaign budget spent during a calendar month.

Field.Title: Month To Date Spend
Field.HelpText: The amount of money spent to date for the month.

Field.Title: Currency Code
Field.HelpText: The account currency type. For possible values, see Currencies.

Field.Title: Account Id
Field.HelpText: The Bing Ads assigned identifier of an account.

Field.Title: Campaign Id
Field.HelpText: The Bing Ads assigned identifier of a campaign.

Field.Title: Account Number
Field.HelpText: The Bing Ads assigned number of an account.

HttpSettings.RequestBody: @{ string RequiredFields = "AccountName,CampaignName,Date,CurrencyCode,AccountNumber"; } <s:Envelope xmlns:s="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/"> @GenerateDefaultSubmitHeader() <s:Body> <SubmitGenerateReportRequest xmlns="https://bingads.microsoft.com/Reporting/v13"> <ReportRequest i:type="BudgetSummaryReportRequest" xmlns:i="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"> @GenerateDefaultSubmitOptions() <Columns> @GenerateReportColumns(Model.SelectedFields, RequiredFields, "BudgetSummary") </Columns> <Filter/> <Scope> <AccountIds xmlns:a1="http://schemas.microsoft.com/2003/10/Serialization/Arrays"> <a1:long>@(Model.AccountId)</a1:long> </AccountIds> @(!string.IsNullOrEmpty(Model.CampaignId) ? GenerateCampaignsScope() : string.Empty) </Scope> @GenerateTimeScope() </ReportRequest> </SubmitGenerateReportRequest> </s:Body> </s:Envelope>

RestConnector.Title: Age Gender Audience
RestConnector.HelpText: Use this report to discover how your campaigns and ad groups are resonating with different age groups and genders.

Text.Title: Filter by Ad Group Id (Optional)
Text.HelpText: Requires AccountId and CampaignId Filters if used

Field.Title: AccountName [D]
Field.HelpText: The account name.

Field.Title: CampaignName [D]
Field.HelpText: The campaign name.

Field.Title: AdGroupName [D]
Field.HelpText: The ad group name.

Field.Title: TimePeriod [D]
Field.HelpText: The time period of each report row.

Field.Title: Gender [D]
Field.HelpText: The gender (male or female) of the search users to whom the ad was delivered.

Field.Title: AgeGroup [D]
Field.HelpText: The age group of the audience who viewed the ad.

Field.Title: AccountStatus [D]
Field.HelpText: The account status.

Field.Title: AdDistribution [D]
Field.HelpText: The network where you want your ads to show.
The number of conversions from other ads within the same account that were preceded by one or more clicks from this ad.
Clicks are what you pay for. Clicks typically include a customer clicking an ad on a search results page or on a website on the search network.
The number of conversions. A conversion is the completion of an action by a customer after viewing your ad.

Field.Title: ExtendedCost
Field.HelpText: Cost information that is optionally provided by advertisers, including non-advertising costs, taxes, and shipping.
The number of times an ad has been displayed on search results pages.
The revenue optionally reported by the advertiser as a result of conversions.
The cost per click (CPC) summed for each click.
The Bing Ads assigned identifier of an account.
The Bing Ads assigned identifier of a campaign.
The Bing Ads assigned identifier of an ad group.
The Bing Ads assigned number of an account.

HttpSettings.RequestBody: @{ string RequiredFields = "AccountName,AdGroupName,AgeGroup,Gender,TimePeriod"; } <s:Envelope xmlns:s="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/"> @GenerateDefaultSubmitHeader() <s:Body> <SubmitGenerateReportRequest xmlns="https://bingads.microsoft.com/Reporting/v13"> <ReportRequest i:type="AgeGenderAudienceReportRequest" xmlns:i="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"> @GenerateDefaultSubmitOptions() <Aggregation>@(Model.Aggregation)</Aggregation> <Columns> @GenerateReportColumns(Model.SelectedFields, RequiredFields, "AgeGenderAudience") </Columns> <Filter/> <Scope> <AccountIds xmlns:a1="http://schemas.microsoft.com/2003/10/Serialization/Arrays"> <a1:long>@(Model.AccountId)</a1:long> </AccountIds> @(!string.IsNullOrEmpty(Model.CampaignId) ? GenerateCampaignsScope() : string.Empty) @(!string.IsNullOrEmpty(Model.CampaignId) && !string.IsNullOrEmpty(Model.AdGroupId) ? GenerateAdGroupsScope() : string.Empty) </Scope> @GenerateTimeScope() </ReportRequest> </SubmitGenerateReportRequest> </s:Body> </s:Envelope>

RestConnector.Title: Goals And Funnels
RestConnector.HelpText: Use this report to discover whether your audience completes each step through the land, browse, prospect, and conversion pages of your website.

Text.Title: Filter by Ad Group Id (Optional)
Text.HelpText: Requires AccountId and CampaignId Filters if used

Field.Title: AccountName [D]
Field.HelpText: The account name.

Field.Title: CampaignName [D]
Field.HelpText: The campaign name.

Field.Title: AdGroupName [D]
Field.HelpText: The ad group name.

Field.Title: TimePeriod [D]
Field.HelpText: The time period of each report row.

Field.Title: Goal [D]
Field.HelpText: The name of your event tracking or campaign analytics goal.

Field.Title: Keyword [D]
Field.HelpText: The keyword text.

Field.Title: Goal Type [D]
Field.HelpText: The goal type.

Field.Title: KeywordStatus [D]
Field.HelpText: The keyword status.

Field.Title: DeviceType [D]
Field.HelpText: The device name attribute of a device OS target bid. The type of device which showed ads.

Field.Title: AccountStatus [D]
Field.HelpText: The account status.
The number of conversions from other ads within the same account that were preceded by one or more clicks from this ad.
The revenue optionally reported by the advertiser as a result of conversions.
The number of conversions. A conversion is the completion of an action by a customer after viewing your ad.
The Bing Ads assigned identifier of a goal.
The Bing Ads assigned identifier of a keyword.
The Bing Ads assigned identifier of an account.
The Bing Ads assigned identifier of a campaign.
The Bing Ads assigned identifier of an ad group.
The Bing Ads assigned identifier of an ad.
The Bing Ads assigned number of an account.

HttpSettings.RequestBody: @{ string RequiredFields = "Goal,TimePeriod"; } <s:Envelope xmlns:s="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/"> @GenerateDefaultSubmitHeader() <s:Body> <SubmitGenerateReportRequest xmlns="https://bingads.microsoft.com/Reporting/v13"> <ReportRequest i:type="GoalsAndFunnelsReportRequest" xmlns:i="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"> @GenerateDefaultSubmitOptions() <Aggregation>@(Model.Aggregation)</Aggregation> <Columns> @GenerateReportColumns(Model.SelectedFields, RequiredFields, "GoalsAndFunnels") </Columns> <Filter/> <Scope> <AccountIds xmlns:a1="http://schemas.microsoft.com/2003/10/Serialization/Arrays"> <a1:long>@(Model.AccountId)</a1:long> </AccountIds> @(!string.IsNullOrEmpty(Model.CampaignId) ? GenerateCampaignsScope() : string.Empty) @(!string.IsNullOrEmpty(Model.CampaignId) && !string.IsNullOrEmpty(Model.AdGroupId) ? GenerateAdGroupsScope() : string.Empty) </Scope> @GenerateTimeScope() </ReportRequest> </SubmitGenerateReportRequest> </s:Body> </s:Envelope>

RestConnector.Title: Audience Performance
RestConnector.HelpText: Use this report to compare delivery performance statistics by audience, ad group, campaign, or account attributes.

Text.Title: Filter by Ad Group Id (Optional)
Text.HelpText: Requires AccountId and CampaignId Filters if used

Field.Title: AccountName [D]
Field.HelpText: The account name.

Field.Title: CampaignName [D]
Field.HelpText: The campaign name.

Field.Title: AdGroupName [D]
Field.HelpText: The ad group name.

Field.Title: AudienceName [D]
Field.HelpText: The audience name.

Field.Title: TimePeriod [D]
Field.HelpText: The time period of each report row.

Field.Title: AssociationStatus [D]
Field.HelpText: The status of the association between the ad group and remarketing list, which indicates whether ads are eligible to display.

Field.Title: BidAdjustment [D]
Field.HelpText: This attribute reflects the current value of your ad group's audience bid adjustment

Field.Title: TargetingSetting [D]
Field.HelpText: This attribute reflects the current value of your ad group's audience targeting setting.

Field.Title: AudienceType [D]
Field.HelpText: The audience type.
The number of times an ad has been displayed on search results pages.
Clicks are what you pay for. Clicks typically include a customer clicking an ad on a search results page or on a website on the search network.
The click-through rate (CTR) is the number of times an ad was clicked, divided by the number of times the ad was shown (impressions).
The cost per click (CPC) summed for each click.
The average position of the ad on a webpage.
The number of conversions. A conversion is the completion of an action by a customer after viewing your ad.
The number of conversions, divided by the total number of clicks.
The formula for calculating the cost per conversion is (Spend / Conversions).
The Bing Ads assigned identifier of an account.
The Bing Ads assigned identifier of a campaign.
The Bing Ads assigned identifier of an ad group.
The Bing Ads assigned number of an account.

HttpSettings.RequestBody: @{ string RequiredFields = "AccountId,AudienceId,TimePeriod"; } <s:Envelope xmlns:s="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/"> @GenerateDefaultSubmitHeader() <s:Body> <SubmitGenerateReportRequest xmlns="https://bingads.microsoft.com/Reporting/v13"> <ReportRequest i:type="AudiencePerformanceReportRequest" xmlns:i="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"> @GenerateDefaultSubmitOptions() <Aggregation>@(Model.Aggregation)</Aggregation> <Columns> @GenerateReportColumns(Model.SelectedFields, RequiredFields, "AudiencePerformance") </Columns> <Filter/> <Scope> <AccountIds xmlns:a1="http://schemas.microsoft.com/2003/10/Serialization/Arrays"> <a1:long>@(Model.AccountId)</a1:long> </AccountIds> @(!string.IsNullOrEmpty(Model.CampaignId) ? GenerateCampaignsScope() : string.Empty) @(!string.IsNullOrEmpty(Model.CampaignId) && !string.IsNullOrEmpty(Model.AdGroupId) ? GenerateAdGroupsScope() : string.Empty) </Scope> @GenerateTimeScope() </ReportRequest> </SubmitGenerateReportRequest> </s:Body> </s:Envelope>

RestConnector.Title: Keyword Performance
RestConnector.HelpText: Use this report to find out which keywords are performing well and those that are not.

Text.Title: Filter by Ad Group Id (Optional)
Text.HelpText: Requires AccountId and CampaignId Filters if used

Number.Title: Rows
Number.HelpText: The top number of data rows to return in the report.

Field.Title: AccountName [D]
Field.HelpText: The account name.

Field.Title: CampaignName [D]
Field.HelpText: The campaign name.

Field.Title: AdGroupName [D]
Field.HelpText: The ad group name.

Field.Title: TimePeriod [D]
Field.HelpText: The time period of each report row.

Field.Title: Keyword [D]
Field.HelpText: The keyword text.

Field.Title: DeviceType [D]
Field.HelpText: The device name attribute of a device OS target bid. The type of device which showed ads.

Field.Title: Network [D]
Field.HelpText: The combined search advertising marketplace made up of Bing, AOL, Yahoo, and partner sites.

Field.Title: DeliveredMatchType [D]
Field.HelpText: The match type used to deliver an ad.

Field.Title: AdType [D]
Field.HelpText: The ad type.

Field.Title: AdDistribution [D]
Field.HelpText: The network where you want your ads to show.

Field.Title: BidStrategyType [D]
Field.HelpText: The bid strategy type.
The number of times an ad has been displayed on search results pages.
Clicks are what you pay for. Clicks typically include a customer clicking an ad on a search results page or on a website on the search network.
The click-through rate (CTR) is the number of times an ad was clicked, divided by the number of times the ad was shown (impressions).
The average cost per click (CPC). The total cost of all clicks on an ad divided by the number of clicks.
The maximum cost per click bid that was in effect at the time the report was generated.
How closely related your ads is to the customer's search query or other input.
The cost per click (CPC) summed for each click.
The average position of the ad on a webpage.
The number of conversions. A conversion is the completion of an action by a customer after viewing your ad.
The number of conversions, divided by the total number of clicks.
The formula for calculating the cost per conversion is (Spend / Conversions).
An aggregate quality assessment of all landing pages on your site.
How well your keyword competes against other keywords targeting the same traffic.
The number of conversions from other ads within the same account that were preceded by one or more clicks from this ad.
The revenue optionally reported by the advertiser as a result of conversions.
The numeric score shows you how competitive your ads are in the marketplace by measuring how relevant your keywords and landing pages are to customers' search terms.
The numeric score that indicates the possible increase in the number of impressions that the keyword could receive if the corresponding QualityScore column would rise above underperforming
The return on ad spend (ROAS). The formula for calculating the ROAS is (Revenue / Spend).
The cost per assist. The formula for calculating the cost per assist is (Spend / Assists).
The revenue per conversion. The formula for calculating the revenue per conversion is (Revenue / Conversions).
The revenue per assist. The formula for calculating the revenue per assist is (Revenue / Assists).
The Bing Ads assigned identifier of a keyword.
The Bing Ads assigned identifier of an account.
The Bing Ads assigned identifier of a campaign.
The Bing Ads assigned identifier of an ad group.
The Bing Ads assigned number of an account.

HttpSettings.RequestBody: @{ string RequiredFields = "TimePeriod"; } <s:Envelope xmlns:s="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/"> @GenerateDefaultSubmitHeader() <s:Body> <SubmitGenerateReportRequest xmlns="https://bingads.microsoft.com/Reporting/v13"> <ReportRequest i:type="KeywordPerformanceReportRequest" xmlns:i="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"> @GenerateDefaultSubmitOptions() <Aggregation>@(Model.Aggregation)</Aggregation> <Columns> @GenerateReportColumns(Model.SelectedFields, RequiredFields, "KeywordPerformance") </Columns> <Filter/> <MaxRows>@(Model.Rows)</MaxRows> <Scope> <AccountIds xmlns:a1="http://schemas.microsoft.com/2003/10/Serialization/Arrays"> <a1:long>@(Model.AccountId)</a1:long> </AccountIds> @(!string.IsNullOrEmpty(Model.CampaignId) ? GenerateCampaignsScope() : string.Empty) @(!string.IsNullOrEmpty(Model.CampaignId) && !string.IsNullOrEmpty(Model.AdGroupId) ? GenerateAdGroupsScope() : string.Empty) </Scope> @GenerateSorting() @GenerateTimeScope() </ReportRequest> </SubmitGenerateReportRequest> </s:Body> </s:Envelope>

RestConnector.Title: User Location Performance
RestConnector.HelpText: Use this report to see where your traffic is coming from broken out by the physical location and the location people are searching for.

Text.Title: Filter by Ad Group Id (Optional)
Text.HelpText: Requires AccountId and CampaignId Filters if used

Field.Title: AccountName [D]
Field.HelpText: The account name.

Field.Title: CampaignName [D]
Field.HelpText: The campaign name.

Field.Title: AdGroupName [D]
Field.HelpText: The ad group name.

Field.Title: TimePeriod [D]
Field.HelpText: The time period of each report row.

Field.Title: Country [D]
Field.HelpText: The country where the user was physically located when they clicked the ad.

Field.Title: City [D]
Field.HelpText: The city where the user was physically located when they clicked the ad.

Field.Title: County [D]
Field.HelpText: The county where the user was physically located when they clicked the ad.

Field.Title: State [D]
Field.HelpText: The state where the user was physically located when they clicked the ad.

Field.Title: MetroArea [D]
Field.HelpText: The metro area where the user was physically located when they clicked the ad.

Field.Title: PostalCode [D]
Field.HelpText: The postal code where the user was physically located when they clicked the ad.

Field.Title: Language [D]
Field.HelpText: The language of the country the ad is served in.

Field.Title: DeviceType [D]
Field.HelpText: The device name attribute of a device OS target bid. The type of device which showed ads.

Field.Title: Network [D]
Field.HelpText: The combined search advertising marketplace made up of Bing, AOL, Yahoo, and partner sites.

Field.Title: DeliveredMatchType [D]
Field.HelpText: The match type used to deliver an ad.

Field.Title: AdDistribution [D]
Field.HelpText: The network where you want your ads to show.
The number of times an ad has been displayed on search results pages.
Clicks are what you pay for. Clicks typically include a customer clicking an ad on a search results page or on a website on the search network.
The click-through rate (CTR) is the number of times an ad was clicked, divided by the number of times the ad was shown (impressions).
The average cost per click (CPC). The total cost of all clicks on an ad divided by the number of clicks.
The cost per click (CPC) summed for each click.
The average position of the ad on a webpage.
The number of conversions. A conversion is the completion of an action by a customer after viewing your ad.
The number of conversions, divided by the total number of clicks.
The formula for calculating the cost per conversion is (Spend / Conversions).
The number of conversions from other ads within the same account that were preceded by one or more clicks from this ad.
The revenue optionally reported by the advertiser as a result of conversions.
The return on ad spend (ROAS). The formula for calculating the ROAS is (Revenue / Spend).
The cost per assist. The formula for calculating the cost per assist is (Spend / Assists).
The revenue per conversion. The formula for calculating the revenue per conversion is (Revenue / Conversions).
The revenue per assist. The formula for calculating the revenue per assist is (Revenue / Assists).
The Bing Ads assigned identifier of an account.
The Bing Ads assigned identifier of a campaign.
The Bing Ads assigned identifier of an ad group.
The Bing Ads assigned number of an account.

HttpSettings.RequestBody: @{ string RequiredFields = "AccountId,TimePeriod"; } <s:Envelope xmlns:s="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/"> @GenerateDefaultSubmitHeader() <s:Body> <SubmitGenerateReportRequest xmlns="https://bingads.microsoft.com/Reporting/v13"> <ReportRequest i:type="UserLocationPerformanceReportRequest" xmlns:i="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"> @GenerateDefaultSubmitOptions() <Aggregation>@(Model.Aggregation)</Aggregation> <Columns> @GenerateReportColumns(Model.SelectedFields, RequiredFields, "UserLocationPerformance") </Columns> @GenerateLocationPerformanceFilter() <Scope> <AccountIds xmlns:a1="http://schemas.microsoft.com/2003/10/Serialization/Arrays"> <a1:long>@(Model.AccountId)</a1:long> </AccountIds> @(!string.IsNullOrEmpty(Model.CampaignId) ? GenerateCampaignsScope() : string.Empty) @(!string.IsNullOrEmpty(Model.CampaignId) && !string.IsNullOrEmpty(Model.AdGroupId) ? GenerateAdGroupsScope() : string.Empty) </Scope> @GenerateTimeScope() </ReportRequest> </SubmitGenerateReportRequest> </s:Body> </s:Envelope>

RestConnector.Title: Search Query Performance
RestConnector.HelpText: Compare how well different versions of your ad extensions are performing with each ad.

Text.Title: Filter by Ad Group Id (Optional)
Text.HelpText: Requires AccountId and CampaignId Filters if used

Checkbox.Title: Exclude Zero Clicks
Checkbox.HelpText: If true, search terms that had one or more ad impressions but resulted in zero clicks will be excluded from the report.

Field.Title: AccountName [D]
Field.HelpText: The account name.

Field.Title: CampaignName [D]
Field.HelpText: The campaign name.

Field.Title: AdGroupName [D]
Field.HelpText: The ad group name.

Field.Title: TimePeriod [D]
Field.HelpText: The time period of each report row.

Field.Title: SearchQuery [D]
Field.HelpText: The search term used by your potential audience.

Field.Title: Keyword [D]
Field.HelpText: The keyword text.

Field.Title: Language [D]
Field.HelpText: The language of the country the ad is served in.

Field.Title: DeviceType [D]
Field.HelpText: The device name attribute of a device OS target bid. The type of device which showed ads.

Field.Title: Network [D]
Field.HelpText: The combined search advertising marketplace made up of Bing, AOL, Yahoo, and partner sites.

Field.Title: DeliveredMatchType [D]
Field.HelpText: The match type used to deliver an ad.

Field.Title: AdType [D]
Field.HelpText: The ad type.
The number of times an ad has been displayed on search results pages.
Clicks are what you pay for. Clicks typically include a customer clicking an ad on a search results page or on a website on the search network.
The click-through rate (CTR) is the number of times an ad was clicked, divided by the number of times the ad was shown (impressions).
The average cost per click (CPC). The total cost of all clicks on an ad divided by the number of clicks.
The cost per click (CPC) summed for each click.
The average position of the ad on a webpage.
The number of conversions. A conversion is the completion of an action by a customer after viewing your ad.
The number of conversions, divided by the total number of clicks.
The formula for calculating the cost per conversion is (Spend / Conversions).
The number of conversions from other ads within the same account that were preceded by one or more clicks from this ad.
The revenue optionally reported by the advertiser as a result of conversions.
The return on ad spend (ROAS). The formula for calculating the ROAS is (Revenue / Spend).
The cost per assist. The formula for calculating the cost per assist is (Spend / Assists).
The revenue per conversion. The formula for calculating the revenue per conversion is (Revenue / Conversions).
The revenue per assist. The formula for calculating the revenue per assist is (Revenue / Assists).
The Bing Ads assigned identifier of an account.
The Bing Ads assigned identifier of a campaign.
The Bing Ads assigned identifier of an ad group.
The Bing Ads assigned identifier of an ad.
The Bing Ads assigned number of an account.

HttpSettings.RequestBody: @{ string RequiredFields = "SearchQuery,TimePeriod"; } <s:Envelope xmlns:s="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/"> @GenerateDefaultSubmitHeader() <s:Body> <SubmitGenerateReportRequest xmlns="https://bingads.microsoft.com/Reporting/v13"> <ReportRequest i:type="SearchQueryPerformanceReportRequest" xmlns:i="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"> @GenerateDefaultSubmitOptions() <Aggregation>@(Model.Aggregation)</Aggregation> <Columns> @GenerateReportColumns(Model.SelectedFields, RequiredFields, "SearchQueryPerformance") </Columns> <Filter> <ExcludeZeroClicks>@(Model.ExcludeZeroClicks.ToString().ToLower())</ExcludeZeroClicks> @GenerateLanguageFilter() </Filter> <Scope> <AccountIds xmlns:a1="http://schemas.microsoft.com/2003/10/Serialization/Arrays"> <a1:long>@(Model.AccountId)</a1:long> </AccountIds> @(!string.IsNullOrEmpty(Model.CampaignId) ? GenerateCampaignsScope() : string.Empty) @(!string.IsNullOrEmpty(Model.CampaignId) && !string.IsNullOrEmpty(Model.AdGroupId) ? GenerateAdGroupsScope() : string.Empty) </Scope> @GenerateTimeScope() </ReportRequest> </SubmitGenerateReportRequest> </s:Body> </s:Envelope>
